name: A Democratic Australasia
description: Democracy prevails in Australasia and, for the moment, power remains in the hands of parliament and thus the people. The challenges facing the nation are many, however, and freedom could all too easily slip from our hands if we are not careful.

name: Freedom of the Press
description: To better maintain its grip on the population, Birdwood's regime introduced censorship laws in 1926. Rescinding those laws is all but expected, now that the nation is once again democratic... though it has been a long time since Australasian newspapers have felt free to speak their mind. Hopefully they will remember who loosened their chains.

name: Question of the Unions
description: In the aftermath of the Melbourne Commune, trade unions were made illegal. While many are sceptical of their ideology, the continued draconian enforcement of Birdwood's policies is decidedly unpopular, and thus we must decide whether the unions have a place in modern Australasian society.

name: Lift Martial Law
description: Since the nation's formation, Australasia has in effect been under martial law. Now with democracy restored and power in the hands of Parliament, the government is in a position to restore civil liberties in Australasia.

name: Suppress the Syndicalists
description: The decision is clear: syndicalism is the greatest threat facing the nation, and thus the Australasian Council of Trade Unions must be suppressed with all force. Since the unions have fallen under the sway of these radicals, there can be no compromise.

name: Compromise With Labor
description: The time has come to recognise that Australasia's labour troubles are larger than the syndicalist radicals who try to stir up trouble. There are union leaders with whom we can negotiate, and in time it may be possible to work out a solution that makes for a fairer society as well as cuts the legs out from under the radicals.

name: Call For Unity
description: With the 1939 elections done and democracy having proven itself to be an enduring force in Australasia, the time has come to call on the people of Australasia to pull together and put past conflicts behind them. We must move forward as a nation, a single force that marches bravely into the new world.

name: The Labor Threat is Over
description: We have endured more than our fair share of labour conflict in the 20th Century, and the time has come to put that chapter of our history to a close.

name: The Maori Act
description: Much of the land owned by Maori in New Zealand is economically unproductive. Many are suggesting we turn these barren locations into fruitful sites of industry and commerce. The people of New Zealand are largely opposed to these proposals, however, and want Maori rights to these lands be guaranteed by law. A decision must soon be made as to which we consider more important.

name: Long Live the King!
description: The time has come to re-dedicate ourselves to the British Commonwealth and our place within it. While there are those who might suggest turning our backs on the crown, we say that we are now and shall always be a loyal subject of the King. Long live the Confederation!

name: Increase British Ties
description: While we are no longer in need of direct rule by the British, we would be fools not to realise our future depends heavily on their aid. Let us ask for advisors to help forward our military research efforts, so that we may be a better part of the Entente alliance.

name: Become a Republic
description: It is true that we began as a colony of the British, and we will forever owe our origins to the Motherland. We cannot, however, ignore the heavy hand which the British have employed in our nation... and neither can our people. The time has come to respectfully disengage our political system from the trappings of parliamentary rule and become a republic in full.

name: A New Constitution
description: Becoming a republic has meant the raising of many questions regarding procedure and the rights of the individual citizen. The Australasian constitution will need to be re-written, and we can take this opportunity to forge the kind of government which will take us into the next century and beyond.

name: We March Forward
description: Let us celebrate our status as a free and just society, an Australasia that exists for all its citizens and which leaves none of them behind.

name: Victory for the Syndicalists
description: We have had to wrest victory from the hands of the capitalists, no longer will Australasians be expected to risk their lives to make this country a paradise for a few hundred, or a few thousand greedy, selfish millionaire families! Now the revolution has come to Australasia and we will not let our chance go to waste!

name: Purge the Army
description: The first threat we face is from within: the army is replete with monarchist supporters and those who would stand against the workers. Even if it means a time of readjustment, we must reform the military and sack any and all of its leaders who refuse to support us.

name: Invite British Advisors
description: If there is a Britain to whom we should be loyal, let it be to the one who controls the home isles. The crown might call them traitors, but they are the British people! How can they betray themselves? Let us invite the Union of Britain to join us in marching together towards a new future.

name: Empower the ACTU
description: The Australasian Council of Trade Unions saw us to this point, sheltered the activists and the labour leaders even as they were being hunted down by the police. Now we shall lift them up and give them the power they deserve, a place to oversee the future and well-being of the Australasian worker.

name: The Syndicalists Restore Order
description: It has been a difficult road, but now the chaos must end. No more demonstrations, no more violence that cuts off our own nose to spite our face. The path forward lies with the revolution, and the nation must now face that fact.

name: The Syndicalist Congress
description: The ACTU Congress has seen the syndicalists remain in command. With our future clear, let us plan out future progress for the nation.

name: Establish the ASRC
description: The Australasian Syndicalist Revolutionary Council will oversee the implementation of our policies throughout the nation, changing the lives of every ordinary citizen... and also ensuring that no upstart radicals and monarchists gain a foothold in places of power. True freedom requires vigilance!

name: Unite the Workers
description: So many decades of brainwashing have left many of the nation's workers unable to tell what truly lies in their own interests. We must make a concerted effort to re-educate and win them over to the syndicalist cause. The workers of Australasia must be united as a single force!

name: The Totalist Congress
description: The ACTU Congress has seen the Maximists take their rightful place as captains of the revolution. Now it is time to stride forward and plot out our nation's future progress.

name: Socialisation of the Nation
description: Charting the economic future of the nation and its workers means we are prepared to exercise most vigorous and far-reaching control over the economy, to ensure that what is produced is exactly what the country needs.

name: Mobilise the Revolution
description: The workers of Australasia need to understand that holding onto their rights means defending the revolution. Indeed, we must export the revolution elsewhere. It is only when the workers of the entire world are free that we will be able to relax our guard.

name: The New Business Leaders
description: There is a curious perception that only capitalism can see civilian industry progress, and we must dispel that archaic notion. Business leaders must either be re-educated, or they must be put aside, as true productivity lies in the hands of the nation's workers.

name: Progress in Industry
description: Australasia will make a great leap forward in its industrial capacity, so that production and distribution will be developed in an orderly manner to ensure that our people could enjoy a steadily rising standard in material and cultural conditions.

name: Join the Internationale
description: The time has come to take our place amidst our brothers and sisters of the international syndicalist community. Together we shall be invincible!

name: Victory for the AFM
description: The people have spoken, and now it is time for Australasia to turn its back on a history of colonial oversight and cruelty. No longer will we fight wars in distant lands that shed Australasian blood to no good purpose. Our destiny is our own, and we will not waste this opportunity!

name: Seize Total Control
description: The first step in restoring order is in eliminating the endless debate and controversy that surrounds parliament. The AFM requires total control in order to enact its mandate, and if that means ending elections to impose much-needed reforms on the nation, then so be it! Rights and procedures can be re-introduced at a later date, once Australasia has been transformed.

name: Focus on Propaganda
description: There are far too many voices in the crowds who would seek to tear down our efforts before they even begin. We must sell the message of the AFM across the nation and win over even those who did not vote for us in the election.

name: Cut Ties with the Crown
description: Memories of Gallipoli still run strong in Australasia, and cries of 'never again!' are not enough. We must cut ties with the British not only in terms of our government, but also with our economy and our military alliances. Our nation must stand on its own, and from this day forth we will never again send our sires to the slaughter in a war of European Imperialism.

name: The AFM Restores Order
description: It has been a difficult road, but now the chaos must end. No more demonstrations, no more violence that cuts off our own nose to spite our face. The path forward lies with the AFM, and the nation must now face that fact.

name: New Social Reforms
description: The old Imperialist 'democratic' government never pushed nor strived for true equality, one where the women and minorities stand side by side with the rest of their countrymen to help build a future for us all. We will demonstrate what a truly free Australasia looks like.

name: End White Australasia
description: The White Australasia policy began with the Immigration Restriction Act of 1901 but didn't end there, and encompasses laws enacted specifically to ensure non-Europeans had a difficult time emigrating to the nation. The time has come to dismantle these laws, even if some people might not like it. Australasia needs to grow, and it must do so as a free society.

name: The Monarchist Officers
description: The military is filled with officers loyal to the monarchist regime, and the time has come to remove them from their posts. It will mean a difficult transition period, but we need a military that is committed to Australasia and Australasia alone, not one where the threat of British interference or even a coup remains dangling over the head of our leaders like the Sword of Damocles.

name: Fortress Australasia
description: Our nation must have strong borders, an unassailable island that no enemy would dare to invade. We must be a tower of strength and prove to the rest of the world that we have no need of British protection - only the seas and the determination of our fearless soldiers.

name: Enact the State Economy
description: Unfettered capitalism is what led to our sorry state, and thus new laws must be enacted to ensure that the Australasian economy is guided by the government and a single principle: that it work towards the betterment of us all.

name: The New Trade Office
description: Australasian trade practices are littered with the remnants of our colonial past: bureaucrats who are all too used to providing favouritism to the Commonwealth instead of seeking fair deals and profits. We must clear them out and forge a new trade office that puts our own nation and the good of its people ahead of an old boys' network that is a relic of the past.

name: On Our Own
description: We have no need of allies - Australasia is a nation that will stand on its own and assume a position of neutrality and strength.

name: Ties With Japan
description: If we are to look for closer ties to a power closer to home, we need look no further than the mighty nation of Japan to the north. With the White Australasia policy ended, we have demonstrated our willingness to view Asian neighbours with an equal eye... and now we must entreat them to look on us as a place where business can be done.

name: United We Stand
description: Let us celebrate our status as a free and just republic, no longer under the yoke of colonial masters and subject to their endless wars and cruelty. We stand united in a hostile world, boldly marching into the future with no-one to tell us otherwise.

name: Victory for the Guard
description: Australasia faces many grave dangers - foreign powers that would see us ground down, syndicalists who lie to our workers and would see our nation plunged into chaos. We will not abandon our traditions and our history for the sake of flashy revolution. Order must be maintained for the sake of all Australasians, and we will see our nation shine like never before!

name: Create the Secret Police
description: The problem with the old governments is that they were unwilling to do what needed to be done in order to secure Australasia's safety - and that means watching the people carefully for any signs of syndicalist activism and revolt. Notions of freedom are quaint, but they pale in comparison to the needs of security.

name: Reaffirm the Entente Alliance
description: There are some within the Commonwealth who would look on our actions and wonder, but we must reaffirm that we are doing this for the greater good. We do not wish to fall prey to the same mistakes that led to the loss of the Home Isles, and we will show them that we wish to be a strong and effective ally in the fight to come.

name: Crush the Syndicalists
description: There must be no mercy shown to the syndicalists. The way they have entranced the common man, leading them into actions which only endanger us all, must come to an immediate end. We shall have strength and common purpose, and it will come through the shedding of blood.

name: The Australasian Guard Restores Order
description: It has been a difficult road, but now the chaos must end. No more demonstrations, no more violence that cuts off our own nose to spite our face. The path forward lies with the Australasian Guard and with tradition, and the nation must now face that fact.

name: We Need Loyal Officers
description: So many experienced officers from the Weltkrieg have been put aside, shown the door despite all the loyalty they have shown to our king and country. It is time to bring them back and show once and for all that dedication to the nation's well-being is the first and primary qualification for leading our troops.

name: Rouse the Masses
description: The people of Australasia are asleep, lulled into a false sense of safety by the thought that they do not have to fight, that wars in distant lands have no bearing on their future. We will dispel that notion, by force if we must. They must all stand, for the king and for country, and the world shall hear us roar!

name: The Royal Advisors
description: We intend to be good allies, and to that end we should invite more advisors to see us through the tough times ahead. Let us lean on our allies as they would lean on us.

name: A Renewed Call to Arms
description: If the Home Isles are to be secured, if the tyranny of syndicalism is to be stopped in its tracks, we must awaken our sense of pride and strength and enlist for the battle to come. Remember Gallipoli, yes, but remember it as a sacrifice to honour and as a baptism in fire which has forged our nation. We will all make such sacrifices in the years to come.

name: Laissez Faire Reforms
description: The socialist urge to restrict and regulate has put a stranglehold on our economy. The time has come to undo those policies and see the corporations of Australasia grow as they were meant to.

name: The New Plan for Australasia
description: We will offer a new deal to the people of our nation: the right to have a job, the right to rise as far as they are capable, the right to work for a better future... so long as it does not come at the expense of our traditions or at the expense of our security. These are our watchwords, and they will give us comfort just as they give us prosperity.

name: A Rising Power
description: We are not declaring our independence from the Empire - far from it. We are, however, asserting ourselves as a regional power within that Empire. Australasia is a strong nation, and a confident member of the Entente, with interests of its own even as they serve those of the king. This is our path forward.

name: To Serve the Empire
description: We hereby affirm that Australasia's path lies with that of the king and the Commonwealth. We are, now and forever more, a loyal member of the Empire and will seek to defend it both here at home as well as elsewhere in the world. Together we will find our path to freedom and true security.

name: The Future is Ours
description: Let us celebrate our hard-won survival and victory, a proud member of the Commonwealth and a bastion against the predations of syndicalism and tyranny. Blood has been shed for this day, and we must honour it, and recognise that all has been fought to provide Australasia a future of which she can be proud.

name: State of the Economy
description: The Australasian economy has been suffering from a severe depression for the last five years. We must assess where opportunities lie and prepare our industry to be properly expanded if we're to have any hope of pulling ourselves out of this quagmire.

name: Liberalise the Economy
description: The solution to our economies woes is to liberalise our laws - allow more access for foreign investors, as well as reduce the amount of regulations which stifle our business sectors.

name: Privatise the Failing Public Sector
description: Almost all of the publicly-owned companies are doing poorly, suffering from mismanagement and even corruption. Rather than revise their practices, perhaps it's best to put them back in the hands of the private sector where they can be run by proper businessmen rather than bureaucrats.

name: Reform the Bureaucracy
description: The main problem facing our economy is the sheer magnitude of the governmental bureaucracy, laden down by archaic rules and focused on colonial exploitation rather than efficiency. We need a modern government which can respond to issues before they can turn into the catastrophe which faces us now, not well after.

name: The New Railways
description: Expansion of the railroad system throughout the east will not only give our mining sectors a shot in the arm, but also provide much-needed employment for a great number of people.

name: Urban Expansion
description: Australasia's cities are already growing rapidly - we must enact policies which will encourage the migration of people from the rural areas into urban ones. If our industrial base is to grow, it will need a ready source of workers ready to man the factories.

name: Wealth of the Antipodes
description: Australia and New Zealand both have massive, untapped resources which need only to be found and properly exploited. Ours is a dominion of mineral wealth which few other countries can hope to compare to... or, at least, it could be.

name: Seek New Markets
description: Rather than stick to our traditional trade partners, perhaps we should make an effort to find other countries that would make for a ready home for Australasian goods? America, Japan, Germany... really, the list is almost endless, and surely remaining solely within the Commonwealth is what has gotten us into our current mess?

name: Trade With the Commonwealth
description: The Commonwealth is where our trade currently lies, and there is plenty more we could do to ensure these bonds become even stronger. We must seek out new trade agreements within the Empire, so that even as we grow stronger so will they.

name: End of the Depression
description: Finally we have pulled ourselves out of the doldrums of depression. Australasia can march into the future, its economy a shining example for others to follow.

name: The New Industrial Act
description: A large number of our outdated rules actually hinder industrial growth. A new law should be introduced to remove those impediments and arrange a system of incentives to companies which will erect large-scale factories in our cities.

name: Industrialise the South
description: Southern Australasia has lagged behind the more cosmopolitan regions in New South Wales, and a campaign should be initiated to promote the south to catch up.

name: Australasian Armaments
description: Up until now, most armaments have been imported from the rest of the Commonwealth. The rise of a proper armament industry will require a great deal of planning and funding, but it is absolutely necessary for the nation's future.

name: Fund the Munitions Plants
description: Our soldiers' guns and our pilots' planes won't do very much without bullets and bombs. We must start encouraging the growth of a real munitions industry in Australasia.

name: Get our Men Back at Work
description: Our nation encompasses vast swaths of open land and crossing them is the most important part of encouraging economic growth. A recent commission promises that a state-funded programme to ensure every Australasian is employed in the construction of new infrastructure could last us for decades, if not more.

name: Seek New Resources
description: All these new roads and railroads have opened up parts of the country to prospectors and mining developers. We should encourage them with incentives.

name: The Australasian Research Council
description: Technological advancement will be the cornerstone of our future success. A recent [Root.AST_AppendRoyalAdjective]commission has advised the government to establish a department to ensure such research is coordinated across the country.

name: Expand the Council
description: Rather than rely on outside assistance, our focus should be on expanding the ARC and ensuring that it has access to the best scientists Australasia can offer.

name: Focus on Radar
description: If Australasia faces an invasion, it will come from across the sea. Thus, we should invest heavily into new radar technologies, and build watch stations along the coast.

name: Focus on Computers
description: Computer technology is in its infancy, but already we can see the benefits it offers to encryption and decryption efforts. Australasia needs to stay ahead of this, or our enemies will end up knowing our moves long before we do.

name: A National University
description: It is important to remember that scholarly pursuits are needed to maintain our position. Generous funding increases to the National University in Canberra will allow us to educate the masses and become a beacon of new research.

name: Increased Research Funding
description: Our research investments to date have paid off - it is time to increase our rate of advancement, to keep pace with the larger nations in the world.

name: New Minds in Australasia
description: Australasia has become a great power in the world. We must assemble these new minds in our universities and put them to work advancing our nation.

name: The Advanced Rocketry Division
description: The future lies in the development of rocket engines - both for our air force as well as for the development of new and powerful weapons that operate at a speed never before achievable.

name: New Oil Exploration
description: Australia and New Zealand have considerable oil reserves, though they are largely contained in offshore and shale deposits. Accessing those deposits, however, should be a priority for our government.

name: Radium Hill Uranium
description: The Radium Hill uranium mine gives us an advantage in the nuclear arms race that few other countries possess: a ready supply of the resource, to use - or not to use - as we desire.

name: State of the [Root.AST_GetNavyName]
description: During the Weltkrieg, the Royal Australian Navy was a small force that consisted of only a few small ships, and plans were to decommission even these as soon as the war ended. With the British Pacific Fleet having fled to our ports, we found ourselves in possession of a fleet that far outstrips our ability to properly manage them. This is our first and foremost issue.

name: Upgrade Naval Facilities
description: Our port facilities have grown, but so far we have nothing that can effectively maintain and repair our oversized fleet. Investments must be made into our naval infrastructure at once.

name: Establish the Naval Academy
description: It is not enough simply to have ships in our fleet - we must train our captains and admirals in the newest methods of naval warfare, to make each one of our vessels worth three of our enemy's.

name: Rebuild Cockatoo Island
description: Cockatoo Island in Sydney Harbour has been the most important shipyard in Australasia since the mid-1800s. It should be refitted and expanded to accommodate more and larger vessels.

name: Overhaul the [Root.AST_GetNavyName]
description: Our efforts have paid off, and now the [Root.AST_GetNavyName] has the skill and capacity to properly manage the Pacific Fleet without aid from the British. Australasia is now a contender for naval supremacy in the region.

name: Upgrade the Reserves
description: Many of the Pacific Fleet's ships were mothballed after the Weltkrieg ended, as we simply did not have the sailors to man them. While the ships are old, they are still serviceable, and with a concerted effort they could be put back into service and make our fleet even more powerful than it is.

name: A Navy for the Pacific
description: Our future naval efforts should focus on increasing the range of our ships and keeping them in top combat form. If they will be fighting, after all, chances are very good that they will be fighting far from home.

name: The [Root.AST_GetRoyalOrRepublican] Marines
description: First and foremost in our offensive naval capabilities is our ability to land on foreign shores with the [Root.AST_GetRoyalOrRepublican] Marines. This must be a fighting force like no other, supported by the most advanced transport vessels the navy can provide.

name: Our Fleet's Foundation
description: Our fleet of destroyers and submarines will always form the backbone of our navy, defending our trade routes just as they attack those of our enemies.

name: Masters of the Sea
description: Powerful battleships will make sure our naval superiority is permanent, and that we are able to project our power well beyond our borders.

name: Scrap the Reserves
description: Almost half of the larger ships in the Pacific Fleet were mothballed after the Weltkrieg ended, as we simply did not have the sailors to man them. While the ships could be brought back online, the cost of doing so is prohibitive, and thus the decision has been made to abandon them entirely and focus on what we already have in service.

name: A Navy for Our Defence
description: Our future naval efforts should focus on keeping our ships close to home, and instead focusing on their speed and defensive abilities. Ours is not an expeditionary force, after all, but one intended to guard our coasts and keep us safe from seaborne invasion.

name: Submarine Focus
description: Submarines are an excellent way to disrupt enemy convoys. We should construct as many as possible.

name: Destroyer Focus
description: Destroyers are effective at destroying enemy submarines. We should ensure our shipping is safe by constructing as many of these as possible.

name: Man the Coasts
description: Foremost on our minds should be the possibility that, one day, and enemy might land forces on our shores. Just because it hasn't happened yet doesn't mean it never will, and we must prepare for that day by fortifying our coastal cities as heavily as we can.

name: The Australasian Shipbuilding Board
description: Most shipbuilding facilities in Australasia are sorely out of date. They must be updated and expanded, ready to expand our fleet.

name: Expand the Dockyards
description: We are finally in a position to expand our shipbuilding capabilities far beyond where they once were.

name: Further Expand the Dockyards
description: We are finally in a position to expand our shipbuilding capabilities far beyond where they once were.

name: State of the [Root.AST_GetAirForceName]
description: In truth, there has really been no [AST_AppendRoyalAdjectiveCap]Australasian Air Force to speak of, and our current planes are barely sufficient in number to guard our own skies never mind project air superiority elsewhere. Considering that the wars of the future will be fought in the air, the government is determined that this must soon change.

name: New Pilot Training
description: The first step in rebuilding our air force is the creation of an air academy, one which can train our future airmen for the battles to come.

name: Expand Archerfield
description: Archerfield air base in Queensland is our largest base in the north, and the one that will be best used to project our air power over the entire northern coast. In any situation where we are fighting a potential invader, this is the base that will be most useful for own defence.

name: The Aviation Industry
description: Building our air force will require expanding and organising our factories for this sole purpose.

name: Build New Fighters
description: As part of our campaign to rule the skies, we should invest resources in our fighters.

name: CAS Focus
description: Close air support allows us to strafe enemy units during battles with frightening accuracy, giving us a large edge on our opponents.

name: Build New Bombers
description: As part of our campaign to support the army from the air, we should invest resources in our bombers.

name: Naval Bomber Focus
description: Naval Bombers allow us to destroy enemy navies without risking our own ships. We should build as many of these as possible if our navy is small or busy elsewhere.

name: The Air Observer Corps
description: Our focus should not only be on taking to the skies, but on increasing our defence against those who would take to the skies against us.

name: The Women's Auxiliary
description: A full half of our population is better used in the war effort than sitting at home. Aircraft maintenance, the signal corps and other related tasks will be turned over to women.

name: Expand Northern Presence
description: With our cities mostly on the east and west coasts of the island, Australasia's northern frontier lacks the proper defence or preparation in case of invasion or attack. New military structures in that area will be welcome.

name: Expand the Aviation Industry
description: Building our air force will require expanding and organising our factories for this sole purpose.

name: Rule the Southern Skies
description: Our primary focus is on our air force - the Confederation must recognise where its strength lies and maximise its effectiveness.

name: State of the Army
description: Our ground forces must be a new priority, promoting those generals who can bring the greatest benefit and reforming their methods for the sake of the nation.

name: Modernise the Artillery
description: Australasia's artillery mostly dates from the Weltkrieg. We must modernise our artillery unless we wish our soldiers to be eviscerated without proper support.

name: Relics of the Weltkrieg
description: Our infantry's equipment is old, very old. Most of it saw service during the Weltkrieg, and some sets have been around even longer than that. We must equip our army with modern gear, or else we will not stand a chance in another war.

name: Clarify ANZAC
description: The Australian and New Zealand Army Corps has a long and proud history as one of the best fighting forces in the Empire. Its methods are dated, however, and we should consider carefully what its approach will be going into this new era of warfare.

name: The War Effort
description: Our recruitment practices are outdated - it is time to revise them, and at the same time put out a new call for enlisted soldiers.

name: Invest in Victory
description: We must work together as a nation, indeed politicians from across all ideological spectrums must pull together if we are to see victory in the days to come!

name: The New ANZAC
description: Our army is the core of our defence, and emergency measures must be passed to ensure they have access to the best equipment and the best personnel that we can possibly provide. When our enemies see the ANZAC symbol, they should know they face among the very best soldiers the world has to offer.

name: Focus on Mobility
description: The quality of our forces do not matter half so much as their mobility. This is a new era, and tactics of encirclement and reach are far more vital to victory than ever before. This must be the focus on Australasia's military future.

name: The Sentinel Project
description: Mobility does not mean simply building tanks - there is also the question of mobilising our infantry units, by building mechanised transport which will get them to the front quickly.

name: Focus on Quality
description: We do not have the industrial capacity for a large or armoured force. Instead we must focus on keeping Australasia's army small yet well-equipped and well-trained. Size is not as important as quality!

name: The Australasian Catering Corps
description: Ours is a treacherous land, and it is our military engineers, medics and maintenance companies that often keep entire units alive and on the move. However, as our army expands, so too must our support companies. They are the backbone of our operations, after all.

name: New Officer Training
description: The training of our officer corps needs updating - the methods of warfare are progressing faster than anyone could possibly hope to keep pace, and yet we must try.

name: Small Unit Tactics
description: It is becoming increasingly apparent that small and very specialised military units are what our armed forces most desperately need.

name: Bring on the Mountaineers
description: Australasia is a land of rugged terrain, one that can provide soldiers skilled at fighting in the harshest environments around the world. We must take advantage of this at once.

name: Z Special Unit
description: Military advisors have been suggesting the creation of an expert unit of our best commandos, armed with the latest technology. Designated 'Z Special Unit', they will be a shining example of all the nation has to offer.

name: Focus on Urban Combat
description: Our forces will engage in combat in modern cities, and we must adjust our tactics to match.

name: Focus on Jungle Combat
description: The southern Pacific and Southeast Asia are full of jungles and little more. If this is a field we expect to fight on, then we must prepare our units to fight in them. Special bases should be constructed to that effect in the northern reaches of Queensland, where our jungles are at their most dense.

name: Focus on Defence
description: Any attempt to project our military power beyond our borders is doomed to bring little more than grief. Our focus, as a nation, should be on our own defence.

name: Fortify the Cities
description: Building up the defences of our cities is the best way to ensure we are on superior ground, should the enemy ever bring their forces to our doorstep.

name: Increase the Reserves
description: Conscription laws have been enacted, but they are insufficient. In the name of our defence, we must see to it that everyone takes part in defending king and country.

name: Enact the Anderson Doctrine
description: Former Admiral David Murray Anderson has long called for a renewed commitment to completing what he was unable to in 1925: the reclamation and protection of the British territories in Asia and the Pacific. While dangerously revanchist, this 'Anderson Doctrine' is fast gaining in popularity.
